creatureDetails.Arva: 8’ tall, black-green scales with tribal swirls. Muscular. Very aggressive, use traps and dirty tricks to kill.
creatureDetails.Astral Spinner: Spiderlike footlong metallic creatures, big butt with red/blue sphere. shift between Planes. Defensive. Try to getvictims tangled into webs, often won’t attack directly.
creatureDetails.Blindfire Carpet: Feathery leaves and 20’ vines, orange peppers. Solitary. Silent. 5’ maw in center uses vines to grab and eatcreatures. Rears up. Target maw.
creatureDetails.Blindfire Vine: Like carpet, long vines with grabby tips, dangles ceilings.
creatureDetails.Boar: Brown, 5’ long 3’ tall, sleep in shallow holes, attempt to wound and flee, flame retardant
creatureDetails.Boltforager: Red feathers, bony yellow ridge spike, 3’ tall. Attack from above with spike/talons, emit puffs of orange smoke to infect targets with worms. Worms hatch in d6 days.
creatureDetails.Boneback Wydarr: 4’ tall stout bony-ridged creature. Long pink tongues reptile head. Hooks instead of forelegs. Vicious andenergetic, slashing, biting, tripping, working with group tactics.
creatureDetails.Bonebinder:
10’ tall, gaunt pale skin, covered in bags and pouches. Peaceful thinkers.
  • Peaceful thinkers and shaman
  • Leaders of the Night Axe
  • Bind spells into bones
  • Long-term goals and prosperity
creatureDetails.Broadback: 25’ tall, wide misshapen lizards, hunches forward, thick scaly hides, spikes and armored plates. Gentle Herbivores.Loud mating call. Paths of devastation in wake.
creatureDetails.Combustarino:
• Sadistic Fire Imps who follow Svarku
  • Amused by inflicting pain and killing
  • Love new identity, not just Fire Imp
  • Butterfly knives, metal emblem
creatureDetails.Copperback: Large 5’ snake with copper scales. Strike with incredible speed, venom puts enemies to sleep. Prefers to attackonce, and then flee danger.
creatureDetails.Coppermane Prowler: Body of a cat, birdlike head wingless griffin. 10’ long, 4’ tall. Mane of copper shards. Solitary. Bites withelectric power. Can teleport 40’, leaving trail of electricity
creatureDetails.Coralkin Angler: Slimy green bipedal armored. 7’ tall, fish tail, webbed hands/feet. Lives with Spawn. Awkward on land, leapingattack. Prefer fight underwater and kick against walls.
creatureDetails.Coralkin Spawn: 1’ tadpoles with large teeth. Swarm will attack anything nearby. Venom worsens each bite.
creatureDetails.Crystal Frog: small crystal frog, thumb-sized. Can bond with creatures like a dog. Twitter like birds. Can heal owner.
creatureDetails.Crystalback Wydarr: 4’ tall hunchback crystal spined creatures. Metallic iron/steel/ silver plates, reptile head. Forelegs are crystalscythes. Digs through dense stone. Snapping jaws and smashing crystals. Launch one another at targets.
creatureDetails.Dire Boar: Huge tusks, 20’ long 10’ tall, destroys environments, solitary. Charge & trample enemies with tusks
creatureDetails.Duecadre: 8’ tall flightless birds, speckled browns and greys, tails yellow. Qwop, Qwop, Qwop every sunrise. Carnivores.Solitary. Kicks and claws. Extremely sharp beak. Docile.
creatureDetails.Earth Elemental: 2 feet tell d20 made of stone. Can create earth from nothing and manipulate it.
creatureDetails.Earth Imp: 3’ tall, short and fat stone, talkative and extremely friendly. Eager to tell stories and hear stories. Nonviolent. Don’t like mocking.
creatureDetails.Edgesworn:
11’ tall, thickly muscled with bony protrusions.
  • Vicious and terrible warriors
  • No tongues
  • Can shape obsidian with bare hands
  • Embrace anger. Live for battle
  • Path of Speed - faster attacks
  • Path of Fury - can berserk
  • Path of Terror - strike fear foes & allies
creatureDetails.Feeder: 3’ long, 5’ wingspan. Slowly flies. Large legs, long propitious to drain blood. Docile.
creatureDetails.Fire Elemental: 2 feet tell d10 made of glowing metal. Can create fire from nothing and manipulate it.
creatureDetails.Fire Imp: 3’ tall, red skin with small wings. obsessed with fair fights and grappling. Rarely fight to the death, but always“fight fair”.
creatureDetails.Flayfiend: 12’ long, 6’ tall, covered in grey hide and bone-spines curving back. 4 large tusks. Spines break easily, difficultto remove. Eat only skin. Solitary. Aggressive and territorial. Charge and trample with tusks.
creatureDetails.Giant Bat: Large black wings, eyes reflect hypnotic lights, sounds like barking, 4-5’ tall. Swoop down at eyes and face. Willretreat if losing, return with entire colony, bringing 20+ more.
creatureDetails.Giant Centipede: Red, yellow, or black, 3-6 feet long. Snapping mandibles, tail barb. Found in corpses. Crawl up opponents, snappingand stabbing with tails. Venom paralyzes.
creatureDetails.Giant Rat: 3’ long, 1’ tall. Thick fur of various colors. Semi-opposable thumbs, good climbers. Will fight to the death. Swarm,bite.
creatureDetails.Goa: 7’ tall, thick dark green scales, slitted yellow eyes. Covered in beads, feathers, boar skin bracers. Fight withhonor, seek glory from trophies
creatureDetails.Kiru Ranger: 6’ tall, deep blue scales, orange ridge. Carry little besides longbows. Stealthy. Seek knowledge.
creatureDetails.Kiru Shaman: 6’ tall, light bright blue scales., fur cloak, mithril necklace, bright feathers and flowers. Obsidian spears. Seekknowledge. Peaceful.
creatureDetails.Kujibird: 3’ tall flightless birds. Patches golden scales. run quickly, attack with poison claws. Songs can cause madness.
creatureDetails.Magma Elemental: 2 feet tell d12 glowing from beneath dark rock shards. Can create magma from nothing and manipulate it.
creatureDetails.Magma Imp: 4’ tall, armored glowing form. Try to look cool. Love building something and working with a team. Hate to leavesomething unfinished or be interrupted.
creatureDetails.Matron: 50’ long armored quivering birth sacs. Attached to a cliffside or large trees. Surrounded by other vyderacs. Largeclaws, spits acid. Can explode releasing acid.
creatureDetails.Muttering Serpent: 15’ large snake, mirror like scales. Face resembles your own. Smells like wood shavings. Intelligent, communicatestelepathically, plays with and confuses prey with questions from themselves. Tries to separate and attack.
creatureDetails.Nereid: 5’ tall, smooth blue skin in a humanoid shape; often with tentacles or shark fins or something. Can command water. A troupe of singers trapped in paintings by the Elves and kept by Svarku. 29 free Nereids want to free Meltalia, work with Night Axe revenge.
creatureDetails.Obsidian Bladeguard: 10’ tall vaguely humanoid of jagged obsidian. 8 randomly scattered eyes. Automatons.
creatureDetails.Obsidian Digger: Chunk of obsidian, gives off blue light. 3” to 3’ large. Floating shards used to dig and shape rock. Ignore prettymuch everything. Difficult to damage. fling stone shards.
creatureDetails.Obsidian Giant:
20’ tall, 4 massive legs, body a random jumble of obsidian, two large tusks with spiked trunk.
  • Seven Six Giants, 25 Bladeguards each
  • Work for Ash Barons, assist Svarku
  • Afraid of Edgesworn and Bavmorda
  • Want Svarku to fail, fuel hostilities
  • Order Fuegonauts around, sabotage
creatureDetails.Ooze Elemental: 2’ jelly-like cube. Can create ooze from nothing and manipulate it.
creatureDetails.Ooze Imp: 3’ tall, translucent goop shape shifters. Can take small humanoid form with wings. Love gross pranks. Can mergetogether.
creatureDetails.Orange Sludge: 6’ in diameter. Coat things with orange goo. Crystallizes in dark, evaporate in light. humanoid forms. Attempt tocover and consume. Drop from above, or side paths. Attack anything that moves. Dulls and rusts metal. May be coveredin poison Ambermoss.
creatureDetails.Poison Dart Frog: thumb sized frogs. Toxin extremely potent. Red, Blue, Green, Yellow, Orange, White, Purple or Black.
creatureDetails.Salamander Trickster:
7’ tall, serpentine bodies, 7’ tail. Blue white leathery scales, can cast magic.
  • Ordered to serve Svarku by the Shah
  • Like bullying people
  • Reluctantly following orders
  • Boar meat is intoxicating
creatureDetails.Salamander Warrior:
7’ tall, serpentine bodies, 7’ tail. Yellow orange leathery scales, spears.
  • Ordered to serve Svarku by the Shah
  • Like bullying people
  • Reluctantly following orders
  • Boar meat is intoxicating
creatureDetails.Seeker: 1’ long, 2’ wingspan, large butt. Move very quickly, can sense warm blooded creatures. Rapid fly-by attacks, spitout clouds of itchy powder, numbs and paralyzes.
creatureDetails.Shadow: 6’ tall, fanged shadows with wide mouths. Silent.. Stalk magic creatures. Get faster when struck with spells. Feralattack with claws and appendages.
creatureDetails.Singing Golem: 6’ tall, carved from stone. Naked elven statues. Sing with chimes inside. Often damaged, performing random tasks.
creatureDetails.Spine Dragon: Dense 12’ long, 4’ tall docile. Dull metallic plates protect body. Impervious to all attacks. Dislike cold.Peaceful.
creatureDetails.Steam Elemental: 2’ shining metallic rings covered in water droplets and steam. Can create steam from nothing and manipulate it.
creatureDetails.Steam Imp: 3’ tall, large noses, large ears, grey skin. Can transform into a cloud of steam. Love to gamble on anything andeverything. Telepathic. Fights are for betting, not participating.
creatureDetails.Swarmer: grapefruit sized scarabs, hard red shells. Can hop/fly 10’m. Overwhelm, bite prey, venomous. Does not let go.
creatureDetails.Tabibari: 6’ long, 3’ tall. Short grey fur. Horns grow from fleshy nose. Shared consciousness. Docile.
creatureDetails.Warrior:
10’ tall, large tusks, large bellies. No lips, skeleton grin. Obsidian weapons.
  • Most of the Night Axe
  • Huge, powerful, efficient, good workers
  • Need direction
  • Want freedom and children
  • Struggle with emotions and freedom
creatureDetails.Water Elemental: 2’ pale spheres. Can create water from nothing and manipulate it.
creatureDetails.Water Imp: 2’ tall, blue skin & green gills. Holds their core like a polished soap bubble. Good natured and curious. Lovemysterious and puzzles.
creatureDetails.Zip Bird: Flightless 4’ tall white birds. Small wings. Can leap up to 30’. Can run quickly. Fearless, rush past foes,harassing them with quick attacks. Slash with beak and talons.

Happening: The wydarr have won. There are thousands of them.
Fire-based inhabitants are alive but trapped in giant, new red crystal growths.
All the wydarr vanished last night.
A group of 2d8 dwarves have tunneled in and laid claim to [11–13].
[9] has been washed away by lava.
Steam imps have organized a title bout at [7].
Fire imps are throwing a redneck barbecue at [7].
A Fuegonaut inspection crew is assessing the scope of the wydarr infestation.
Fuegonauts are “blitz mining” easy red crystal pickings.
3d6 Fuegonaut crystal huffers are here causing trouble.
Casino night at [7]. Games that are illegal in five realities!
A gathering of 2d4 rare metal elementals is happening at [13].
Chain gangs of 2d4 humans, dead from dust exposure, litter the mines. Svarku didn’t send them.
All six obsidian giants are here, performing psychic experiments at [10].
All of the crystal is gone. All of it.
